course_title: Staying Healthy in Neonates/Infants: Introduction to Clinical Specialty
class_notes: Online asynchronous with some synchronous sessions and on-campus intensives dates: September 22. Synchronous Zoom sessions: 10/5 and 10/19: 7:30pm - 9:30pm. Intensives: 9/22-9/24 and 10/27-10/29.
course_description: Complementary and integrative strategies for promoting and maintaining health and wellness for the neonate and infant (birth to age 2) will be discussed as well as the influence of culture, social determinants, developmental outcomes and national/global policy.
prerequisites: NRSG 554 or equivalent transfer credit as co-requisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 2988, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: Meets Online, Instructor: Conway-Orgel/Finnerty, Status: Open
